Articles.Content:
There is usually information floating around pertaining to the development of the game that unless I put aside a good bit of time, 49 minutes for example, to watch I usually don't get.

Perhaps there could be an "Official Squadcast thread" stickied in the Suggestions and Development board(or elsewhere, whatever). Anytime the squadcast mentions some hard data on the next update then the original post in that thread could be updated with the pertinent information. This all depends on how much effort that would be for whoever would be posting it. If it would be a pain then please disregard.

Basically, the Squadcast usually has some juicy bits in it, but I cant drop an hour to watch it for just a bullet list of points.

EDIT: I just see "where did you hear that?" "it was in the squadcast" alot, and this would help remedy that.

Edited November 11, 2014 by r4pt0r

Agreed.

FWIW I would suggest uploading a copy of the squadcast to the ksp youtube channel too.

I fully support this. Yes!

Additionally, updating the social media link menu on the forum menu bar with ALL the various channels that the devs frequent regarding KSP iow reddit for example.
Yes, please! I greatly prefer to get my info in text form. Even if some sort of speech-to-text software was used to make a transcript, I can skim text to find what I'm interested in.

Same here. I really don`t want to have to sit through nearly an hour to get the few actual pieces of information SQUAD are wanting us to know.

Absolutely agreed! I enjoy watching the squadcast however all too often I simply don't have the time for it no matter how much I want to watch. Then there's plenty of other times when my rural internet will not permit me enough bandwidth to watch even if I have the time that day.
